contextId.information: Existing in the future is spoken of as coming. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: who is to come

contextId.information: These are first and last letters of the Greek alphabet. Possible meanings are 1) "the one who began all things and who ends all things" or 2) "the one who has always lived and who always will live". If unclear to readers you may consider using the first and last letters of your alphabet. AT: "the A and the Z" or "the first and the last" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: the alpha and the omega

contextId.information: Having the power over something is spoken of as having the keys to it. The implied information is that he can give life to those who have died and let them out of Hades.  AT: "I have the power over death and over Hades"  or "I have the power to give life to people who have died and to let them out of Hades" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I have the keys of death and of Hades

contextId.information: Being discouraged is spoken of as being tired. AT: "you have not become discouraged" or "you have not quit" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: you have not grown weary

contextId.information: To stop doing something is spoken of as leaving it behind. Love is spoken of as if it is an object that can be left behind.  AT "you have stopped loving me as you did at the beginning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: you have left behind your first love

contextId.information: Being willing to listen is spoken of as having an ear. AT: "Let the one who is willing to listen, listen" or "If you are willing, listen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Let the one who has an ear listen

contextId.information: People who gather to obey or honor Satan are spoken of as if they were a synagogue, a place of worship and teaching for the Jews. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: a synagogue of Satan

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1)"who teach what Balaam taught" or 2)"who do what Balaam taught."  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: who hold tightly to the teaching of Balaam

contextId.information: Something that leads people to sin is spoken of as a stone in the road that people stumble on. AT: "who showed Balak how to cause the people of Israel to sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: who taught Balak to throw a stumbling block before the children of Israel

contextId.information: Jesus spoke of her followers as if they were her children. AT: 'her followers" or "the people who do what she teaches" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: her children

contextId.information: Believing a teaching is spoken of as holding the teaching. AT: "everyone who does not believe this teaching" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: everyone who does not hold this teaching

contextId.information: Secret things are spoken of as if they were deep. AT: "secret things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: deep things

contextId.information: Ruling harshly is spoken of as ruling with an iron rod. AT: "He will rule them harshly as if striking them with an iron stick" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: He will rule them with an iron rod

contextId.information: Being willing to listen is spoken of as having an ear. AT: "Let the one who is willing to listen, listen" or "If you are willing, listen." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:02:06|2:7]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Let the one who has an ear listen

contextId.information: The good deeds done by the believers in Sardis are spoken of as if they were alive but in danger of dying. AT: "complete the work that remains, or what you have done will become worthless" or "if you do not finish what you have started to do, your previous work will have been useless" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: strengthen what remains, but is about to die

contextId.information: Jesus speaks of sin in a person's life as if it were dirty clothes. AT: "have not made their lives sinful like dirty clothes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: did not make their clothes dirty

contextId.information: White clothes represent a pure life without sin. AT: "and they will be dressed in white, which shows that they are pure" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: dressed in white

contextId.information: Being willing to listen is spoken of as having an ear. AT: "Let the one who is willing to listen, listen" or "If you are willing, listen." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:02:06|2:7]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Let the one who has an ear listen

contextId.information: People who gather to obey or honor Satan are spoken of as if they were a synagogue, a place of worship and teaching for the Jews. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:02:08|2:9]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: synagogue of Satan

contextId.information: Existing in the future is spoken of as coming. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: is coming

contextId.information: A crown was a wreath, originally of olive branches or laurel leaves,  that was put on the head of a victorious athlete. Here "crown" stands for a reward. See how you translated "crown" in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:02:10|2:10]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: crown

contextId.information: Being willing to listen is spoken of as having an ear. AT: "Let the one who is willing to listen, listen" or "If you are willing, listen." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:02:06|2:7]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Let the one who has an ear

contextId.information: "Cold" and hot" represent two extremes of spiritual interest or love for God. To be "cold" is to be completely against God, and to be "hot" is to be zealous to serve him. AT: "you are like water that is neither cold nor hot" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: you are neither cold nor hot

contextId.information: Rejecting them is spoken of as vomiting them out of the mouth. AT: "I will reject you as I would spit out lukewarm water" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: I am about to vomit you out of my mouth

contextId.information: Jesus speaks of their spiritual condition as if he were speaking about their physical condition. AT: "You are like people who are most miserable, pitiable, poor, blind, and naked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: you are most miserable, pitiable, poor, blind, and naked

contextId.information: Gold that is refined in fire is pure and very valuable. Here the salvation that Jesus offers mankind is spoken of as if it were gold. AT: "Receive from me what is really most valuable, as if it were gold refined by fire"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Buy from me gold refined by fire

contextId.information: White garments represent righteousness. AT: "righteousness, like white garments" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: brilliant white garments

contextId.information: Jesus speaks about wanting people to relate to him as if he wanted them to invite him into their home. AT: "I am like one standing at the door and knocking" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: I am standing at the door and am knocking

contextId.information: This represents being together as friends. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: and will eat with him

contextId.information: Being willing to listen is spoken of as having an ear. AT: "Let the one who is willing to listen, listen" or "If you are willing, listen." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:02:06|2:7]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Let the one who has an ear listen

contextId.information: This expression stands for the ability that God gave John to see into heaven, at least by means of a vision. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: an open door in heaven

contextId.information: How it was like glass or a sea can be stated clearly. Possible meanings are 1) a sea is spoken of as if it were glass. AT: "a sea that was as smooth as glass" or 2) glass if spoken of as if it were a sea. AT: "glass that was spread out like a sea" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: a sea of glass

contextId.information: Existing in the future is spoken of as coming. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: who is to come

contextId.information: The king is spoken of as if he were a lion because a lion is very strong.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: The Lion

contextId.information: The descendant is spoken of as if David's family were a tree and he were a root of that tree. AT: "the Descendant of David" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the Root of David

contextId.information: Believing the word of God and the testimony is spoken of as if they were objects that could be physically held in one's hands. AT: "which they believed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: which they held

contextId.information: Christians are often spoken of as being one another's brothers and sisters. AT: "fellow Christians" or "fellow believers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: brothers and sisters

contextId.information: Being made righteous by the blood of the Lamb is spoken of as washing their robes in his blood. AT: "They have been made righteous by washing their robes white in his blood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: They have washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb

contextId.information: "will put his tent up over them." Protecting them is spoken of as if he were giving them shelter to live under. AT: "will shelter them" or "will protect them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: will spread his tent over them

contextId.information: The elder speaks of the Lamb's care for his people as if it were the shepherd's care for his sheep. AT: "For the Lamb ... will be like a shepherd to them" or "For the Lamb ... will care for them as a shepherd cares for his sheep" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: For the Lamb ... will be their shepherd

contextId.information: Causing something bad to happen to the sun is spoken of as striking, or hitting, it. This can be stated with an active verb. AT: "a third of the sun changed" or "God changed a third of the sun" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: a third of the sun was struck

contextId.information: John speaks of the angel as if he were wearing a cloud as his clothing. This expression may be understood as metaphor. However, because very unusual things were often seen in visions, it might be understood as a literally true statement in its context. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: He was robed in a cloud

contextId.information: Fire burning and killing people is spoken of as if it were an animal that could eat them up. AT: "fire ... will destroy their enemies" or "fire ... will completely burn up their enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: fire ... devours their enemies

contextId.information: John speaks of the sky as if it had a door that can be opened to let rain fall or closed to stop the rain. AT: "to keep rain from falling from the sky"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: to close up the sky so that no rain will fall

contextId.information: Existing in the future is spoken of as coming. AT: "The third woe will happen soon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: The third woe is coming quickly

contextId.information: Ruling harshly is spoken of as ruling with an iron rod. See how  you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:02:26|2:27]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: rule all the nations with an iron rod

contextId.information: The devil is spoken of as if he were a container, and anger is spoken of as if it were a liquid that could be in him. AT: "He is terribly angry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: He is filled with terrible anger

contextId.information: Being willing to listen is spoken of as having an ear. AT: "Let the one who is willing to listen, listen" or "If you are willing, listen." See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:02:06|2:7]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: If anyone has an ear

contextId.information: Doing what the Lamb does is spoken of as following him. AT: "they do whatever the Lamb does" or "they obey the Lamb" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: follow the Lamb wherever he goes

contextId.information: Existing in the present is spoken of as having come. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]]). The idea of "judgment" can be expressed with a verb. AT: "it is now the time for God to judge people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: the hour of his judgment has come

contextId.information: The angel speaks of Babylon being destroyed as if it had fallen.  AT: "Babylon the great has been destroyed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great

contextId.information: Existing in the present is spoken of as having come. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the time to reap has come

contextId.information: How it was like glass or a sea can be stated clearly. Possible meanings are 1) a sea is spoken of as if it were glass. AT: "a sea that was as smooth as glass" or 2) glass if spoken of as if it were a sea. AT: "glass that was spread out like a sea." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:04:06|4:6]] (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: sea of glass

contextId.information: Living the right way is spoken of as keeping one's clothes on. AT: "doing what is right like people keeping their clothes on"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: keeping his garments on

contextId.information: The angel speaks of dying as falling. AT: "Five kings have died"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Five kings have fallen

contextId.information: Not having existed yet is spoken of as not yet having come. AT: "the other has not yet become king; when he becomes king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the other has not yet come; when he comes

contextId.information: The certainty of what will happen in the future is spoken of as if the beast were going to it. AT: "it will certainly be destroyed" or "God will surely destroy it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it is going to destruction

contextId.information: Here "are" stands for "represents." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: The waters you saw, where the prostitute is seated, are peoples, multitudes, nations, and languages

contextId.information: Destroying her completely is spoken of as eating all her flesh. "They will destroy her completely" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: they will devour her flesh

contextId.information: Here "is" stands for "represents." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: is

contextId.information: Babylon is spoken of as if it were a prostitute who has caused other people to sin along with her. This may well have a double meaning: literal sexual immorality and also the worship of false gods. (See:  [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: her immoral passion

contextId.information: The voice speaks of Babylon's sins as if they were objects that could form a pile. AT: "Her sins are so many they are like a pile that reaches heaven"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Her sins have piled up as high as heaven

contextId.information: The voice speaks of punishment as if it were payment. AT: "Punish her as she has punished others" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Pay her back as she has paid others back

contextId.information: The voice speaks of causing others to suffer as preparing strong wine for them to drink.  AT: "prepare for her the wine of suffering that is twice as strong as what she made for others" or "make her suffer twice as much as she made others suffer" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: in the cup she mixed, mix double the amount for her

contextId.information: Experiencing mourning is spoken of as seeing mourning. AT: "I will never mourn" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: I will never see mourning

contextId.information: Being burned up by fires is spoken of as being eaten up by fire. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Fire will completely burn her up" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: She will be consumed by fire

contextId.information: Existing in the present is spoken of as having come. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: your punishment has come

contextId.information: They speak of good things as if they were fruit. AT: "The good things (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: The fruit

contextId.information: The angel speaks of important and powerful people as if they were princes. AT: "your merchants were like princes of the earth" or "your merchants were the most important men in the world" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: your merchants were the princes of the earth

contextId.information: Here John speaks of the joining of Jesus and his people together forever as if it were a wedding celebration. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: wedding celebration of the Lamb ... his bride has made herself ready

contextId.information: Existing in the present is spoken of as having come. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: has come

contextId.information: Here holding stands for believing in or announcing. AT: "who speak the truth about Jesus" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: who hold the testimony about Jesus

contextId.information: John speaks of the rider's power as if he were ruling with an iron rod. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:12:05|12:5]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: rule them with an iron rod

contextId.information: John speaks of the rider's destroying his enemies as if they were grapes that a person tramples in a winepress. Here "wrath" refers to God's punishment of evil persons. AT: "He will crush his enemies according to the judgment of God Almighty, just as a person crushes grapes in a winepress" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: He tramples in the winepress of the fury of the wrath of God Almighty

contextId.information: These are first and last letters of the Greek alphabet. Possible meanings are 1) "the one who began all things and who ends all things" or 2) "the one who has always lived and who always will live". If unclear to readers you may consider using the first and last letters of your alphabet. AT: "the A and the Z" or "the first and the last." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:01:07|1:8]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: the alpha and the omega

contextId.information: God speaks of a person's desire for eternal life as if it were thirst and of that person receiving eternal life as if he were drinking life-giving water. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: To the one who thirsts ... water of life

contextId.information: Here the glory of Jesus, the Lamb, is spoken of as if it were a lamp that gives light to the city. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: its lamp is the Lamb

contextId.information: Eternal life is spoken of as if it were a drink of life-giving water. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:21:05|21:6]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the water of life

contextId.information: These are first and last letters of the Greek alphabet. Possible meanings are 1) "the one who began all things and who ends all things" or 2) "the one who has always lived and who always will live". If unclear to readers you may consider using the first and last letters of your alphabet. AT: "the A and the Z" or "the first and the last." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:01:07|1:8]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
contextId.quote: the alpha and the omega

contextId.information: Becoming righteous is spoken of as if it were washing one's clothing. See how you translated as similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:07:13|7:14]]. AT: "those who have become righteous, as if they have washed their robes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: those who wash their robes

contextId.information: In that culture the dog was an unclean, despised animal. Here the word is derogatory and refers to people who are wicked. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: are the dogs

contextId.information: The words "root" and "descendant" mean basically the same thing. Jesus speaks of being a "descendant" as if he were a "root" that grew out of David. Together the words emphasize that Jesus belongs to the family of David. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]]).
contextId.quote: the root and the descendant of David

contextId.information: Believers are spoken of as if they were a bride about to be married to her groom, Jesus. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the Bride

contextId.information: Eternal life is spoken of as if it were a drink of life-giving water. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:21:05|21:6]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the water of life
